# Understanding The Problem Domain
* What is the hardest thing about writing code?
  - Learning a new technology
  - Naming things
  - Testing your code
  - Debugging
  - Fixing bugs
  - Making software maintainable

#  “Protein Tracker” application
* is that it allows a user to set a goal for the amount of protein to consume in a day.  
* The user can add protein amounts which are added to a total protein count that is tracked for that user.

 <img src="https://spzone-simpleprogrammer.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/Protein_Tracker_2013-07-03_16-44-41_thumb.png">

* Very simple functionality, easily explainable, but most importantly, easily understood.

_______________________
# WHAT IS AN OBJECT? 
* group together a set of variables and functions to create a model of a something you would recognize from the real world. In an object, variables and functions take on new names. 
  - IN AN OBJECT: VARIABLES BECOME KNOWN AS PROPERTIES 
  - FUNCTIONS BECOME KNOWN AS METHODS

 <img src="data:image/png;base64,">

*  <img src="https://bunlong.github.io/assets/img/dot-notation-vs-bracket-notation-to-access-object-properties-in-javascript.png">

# Document Object Model (DOM) 
*  specifies how browsers should create a model of an HTML page and how JavaScript can access and update the contents of a web page while it is in the browser window
* THE DOM TREE IS A MODEL OF A WEB PAGE
  - model is called a DOM tree, and it is stored in the browsers' memory. It consists of four main types of nodes. 
<img src="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/340563169/figure/tbl1/AS:880960795062276@1587048829722/web-page-code-in-simple-HTML-that-contains-html-head-title-body-p-and-footer-tags.png">

<img src="https://i.morioh.com/200725/6b050937.webp">

# WORKING WITH THE DOM TREE
* Accessing and updating the DOM tree involves two steps:
  - Locate the node that represents the element you want to work with.
  - Use its text content, child elements, and attributes.
